## **Part 3: Reflection**

*In a brief paragraph, compare the two maps you created. Describe the visual and data model differences between the DEM datasets visualized in the topology map and the zonal statistics calculated and appended to the parcel dataset in the second map.*

The first map shows continuous elevation data from the DEM(from USGS), where each cell represents the height of the ground. Each pixel is a height and represents 10m x 10m

Visually, it uses color and shading to show hills and valleys, giving a realistic view of Oxfordâ€™s terrain.


The second map shows slope values summarized by parcel using zonal statistics. Instead of showing every elevation cell, it shows the average slope within each property boundary.

This helps us understand the steepness of each property, could be interesting when looking at eminent domain while building a highway. You would want to acquire property that is least steep.

## **Save and share this notebook**

Make sure that your images are all rendering and then share the notebook so that it is viewable by anyone with the link.
